main event: A single cigar-shaped object, 2 inches long and gold in color, was sighted in Laconia, New Hampshire on 25 November 1957. The object was in view for four minutes, maintaining a straight, horizontal course.
interesting points: The object was described as cigar-shaped, 2 inches long, and gold in color, with a cone at one end.
The sighting lasted for four minutes, providing ample time for observation.
The object maintained a straight, horizontal course during the sighting.
The observer, a 19-year-old student, reported fair weather conditions at the time of the sighting.
An intelligence officer suggested the object was an R-52 with a gold color due to sunlight reflection.
sighted object: cigar-shaped object, 2 inches long and gold in color
